article.description: Solomon Mangham and Daman Collins each had double-double, Kofi Andoh scored 13 points and Howard beat Central Penn College 67-60 on Sunday night.
article.headline: Mangham, Collins lead Howard past Central Penn, 67-60
article.linkText: Mangham, Collins lead Howard past Central Penn, 67-60
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Solomon Mangham and Daman Collins each had double-double, Kofi Andoh scored 13 points and Howard beat Central Penn College 67-60 on Sunday night. Mangham had 17 points and 11 rebounds, Collins scored 15 with 12 boards and four assists and Marcel Boyd had 10 points. Howard (3-8) led by 12 at halftime and scored seven-straight points to take a 47-30 lead with 16:37 to play. Joel Zola had two fast-break layups as Central Penn responded with a 9-0 run and then he and Tyrie Orosco hit back-to-back 3s to make it 56-all with 4:39 left. Mangham answered with a jumper before Charles Williams hit a 3-pointer to cap an 8-2 spurt and the Bison led 64-58 about 2 1/2 minutes later. The Knights missed their last five shots and Mangham hit two free throws to cap the scoring with 25 seconds left. Orosco led Central Penn with 24 points on 10-of-16 shooting. Tyree Tucker had 10 points and seven assists.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
